title: 103_hr2143
content:
The Act titled "Nuclear Regulatory Commission Authorization Act for Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995" authorizes appropriations for those fiscal years. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission is authorized to receive appropriations for fiscal years 1994 and 1995, with specific amounts allocated for each year. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission's Office of Inspector General is authorized to receive appropriations of $4,800,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $5,000,000 for fiscal year 1995, in accordance with title 31, United States Code. SEC. 3. ALLOCATION OF AMOUNTS AUTHORIZED. The amounts authorized under section 2(a) for fiscal years 1994 and 1995 are allocated as follows: 
- $163,807,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $168,005,000 for fiscal year 1995 for "Reactor Safety and Safeguards Regulation"
- $99,969,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $98,339,000 for fiscal year 1995 for "Reactor Safety Research"
- $61,880,000 for "Nuclear material and low-level waste safety and safeguards regulation" For fiscal years 1994 and 1995, not more than $61,880,000 and $63,025,000 respectively can be used for "Nuclear Material and Low-Level Waste Safety and Safeguards Regulation." Additionally, not more than $22,000,000 for each fiscal year can be used for "High-Level Nuclear Waste Regulation," and not more than $31,000,000 for reactor special reviews and enforcement. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission has allocated specific amounts for various purposes for fiscal years 1994 and 1995. This includes funds for reactor special reviews, investigations, and enforcement, as well as nuclear safety management and support. The Commission is limited to using no more than 1 percent of the allocated amounts for exercising its authority under the Atomic Energy Act. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can enter into grants and agreements with organizations like universities, governments, and non-profit institutions under the Atomic Energy Act. Grants must comply with relevant laws. Amounts allocated for specific purposes can be reallocated as needed. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can reallocate funds for programs or activities as needed, with a limitation of $500,000 increase or reduction without prior notification to specific committees. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can reallocate funds for programs or activities as needed, with a limitation of $500,000 increase or reduction without prior notification to specific committees. Funds from the Nuclear Waste Fund are designated for high-level nuclear waste activities and cannot be used for other Commission activities. SEC. 4. RETENTION OF CERTAIN FUNDS: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can retain and use funds received for specific programs and services, subject to appropriations, for associated expenses without time limitations. SEC. 5. TRANSFER OF CERTAIN FUNDS: The Commission has the authority to transfer funds as necessary. SEC. 5. TRANSFER OF CERTAIN FUNDS: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can transfer up to 5 percent of the authorized amount to its Office of Inspector General from appropriations, excluding those from the Nuclear Waste Fund. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON SPENDING AUTHORITY: Payments under this Act are subject to advance approval in appropriation Acts.
